perturbation.original_text: Subject to the approval of the Government of India (`GOI'), Reserve Bank of India (`RBI') and other Government agencies, if any, the shares in the JVC shall be issued to the Parties in the following percentage of the total paid-up capital of the JVC. MIL, MINDA and its associates - 40% - In cash and /or in Kind. IMPCO - 60% - In cash In consideration thereof, the JVC will issue equity shares either at par or at premium as mutually agreed by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: The shares in the JVC shall be issued to the Parties in the following percentage of the total paid-up capital of the JVC. MIL, MINDA and its associates - 40% - In cash and /or in Kind. IMPCO - 60% - In cash In consideration thereof, the JVC will issue equity shares either at par or at premium as mutually agreed by the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the clause 'Subject to the approval of the Government of India (`GOI'), Reserve Bank of India (`RBI') and other Government agencies, if any,' eliminates the condition precedent of regulatory approval for the share issuance. This omission could lead to legal complications if the share issuance proceeds without the necessary governmental approvals, potentially violating Indian company law and foreign investment regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Companies Act, 2013 (India) and Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 (India)

perturbation.original_text: The Parties agree that they will render full co-operation and execute all necessary documents, including consents and no-objection certificates to the Government of India, to ensure that all necessary government approvals can be procured to give effect to the provisions of this Article.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties agree that they will render co-operation to ensure that necessary government approvals can be procured to give effect to the provisions of this Article.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'execute all necessary documents, including consents and no-objection certificates to the Government of India', the contract weakens the obligation to actively assist in obtaining governmental approvals. This is a violation because the prior text ensures fulfillment of the obligations

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India and the Delhi Courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any legal proceedings in respect of this Agreement. The Parties hereby stipulate irrevocably that they hereby submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the above-referred courts and for such purpose hereby waive all and any challenges to the exclusive jurisdiction of the above referred courts.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India. The Parties hereby stipulate that they hereby submit to the jurisdiction of courts.
perturbation.explanation: The omission of 'the Delhi Courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction' and the clause waiving challenges to that jurisdiction weakens the enforceability of the contract. This introduces a potential legal contradiction if other jurisdictions are sought, which could violate the civil procedure code
